intro: Papaver macrostomum var. macrostomum, commonly known as the large-mouth poppy, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe. It features striking, showy flowers with bright red petals and a prominent, saucer-shaped corona. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
